markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 19"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ouroboros Buckles](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1850)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 18 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 40,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Armor** [Buckle Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=18)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This ominous-looking _+3 [greater resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [greater acid-resistant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=283) [buckle armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=18)_ is deep red in color, favored by assassins who worship [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=13) or [Asmodeus](/Deities.aspx?ID=2), and if unfastened, the many belts and buckles writhe like living snakes. _Ouroboros buckles_ have the [comfort](/Traits.aspx?ID=203) trait. However, while wearing _ouroboros buckles_, the unfathomable concept of infinity pulls at your mind, and each time you awaken, you'd swear the armor hissed into your ear while you were asleep. The hissing suggested secret wisdom to you in [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), though you only ever remember it vaguely, like a fading dream.

<document level="2" id="action-1545" />

<document level="2" id="action-1546" />

**Craft Requirements** The initial raw materials must include blood from an [ouroboros](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1256) to tan the leather.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Ouroboros Buckles
